name: Amber Axe

attributes.Augments: Annihilation -> +14% critical extra damage, Annihilation -> -8s cooldown

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Amber Greataxe

attributes.Augments: Annihilation -> +14% critical extra damage, Annihilation -> -8s cooldown

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Angelic Axe
notes:
Notes
It's a very rare loot from Mutated Tiger.

name: Axe of Destruction
notes:
Notes
Yana will trade you one for 50 Gold Tokens.

name: Axe
notes:
Notes
Not very useful, however cheap to buy in Rookgaard for lower levels.

name: Barbarian Axe
notes:
Notes
Reward in Barbarian Axe Quest.

name: Battle Axe
notes:
Notes
Good loot from all locations where you can find Orcs and Dwarves.
Reward in Battle Axe Quest.

name: Beastslayer Axe
notes:
Notes
A good one-handed axe for mid-level players. This is the best one-handed axe weapon you can have at level 30, since this is the only one-handed axe at level 30.

name: Broken Iks Spear
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Butcher's Axe
notes:
Notes
They have become more common after Christmas Update 2008, because CipSoft made bigger looting chance on bosses like Hellgorak, since then many axes of this kind exist on many worlds. Many collectors are after this item, usually for house decoration.

name: Chopper of Destruction
notes:
Notes
Yana will trade you one for 50 Gold Tokens.

name: Cobra Axe
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Crude Umbral Axe
notes:
Notes
See also Umbral Creation.

name: Crude Umbral Chopper
notes:
Notes
See also Umbral Creation.

name: Crystalline Axe
notes:
Notes
One of the best obtainable One-Handed axes with melee damage. Its value may vary a lot among worlds, especially world types as they are obtained via Warzones which are considerably tougher on Open PvP and Hardcore PvP worlds.
There are no NPCs who buy this axe, so a knight can stand to lose a lot of money by investing in it.
However on some older servers the price can often go as low as 20,000-40,000 gold if not less, making it a very cheap axe. When prices are this low, it makes it one of the best Zero-Attack Weapons for characters up to level 70.

name: Daramian Axe
notes:
Notes
It seems to be the standard version of the Daramian Waraxe. This is believed to be an Unobtainable Item.

name: Daramian Waraxe
notes:
Notes
Rare loot dropped by Ancient Scarabs and Grave Guards. Its rarity dropped since the Summer Update 2011 introduced creatures dropping it; however, they only appear during a not often occuring World Change. 
Although they both have the same attack values the Naginata is slighty better as best two-handed axe weapon at level 25, because of its higher defense value.

name: Deepling Axe
notes:
Notes
A strong axe weapon, recommended for level 80s until they can use Stonecutter Axe or Hellforged Axe. Part of the Deepling Set.

name: Demonwing Axe
notes:
Notes
The 3rd strongest axe in-game after Umbral Master Chopper and Umbral Master Axe . It is still considerably rare, in spite of being dropped by Hellgorak. This axe was first looted on Menera by Gwircel.

name: Double Axe
notes:
Notes
Very cheap, easily obtainable on new worlds and  can give you an advantage in wars and PvP in the early days of a server.

name: Dragon Lance
notes:
Notes
A strong two-handed axe comparable to a Royal Axe (except that it is two-handed). Used by axe fighters to slay tougher monsters.
Obtainable through the Vampire Shield Quest.

name: Draining Inferniarch Battleaxe
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained via the Doomforge by using a Inferniarch Battleaxe.
None of the Draining Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Vampirism.

name: Draining Inferniarch Greataxe
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained via the Doomforge by using an Inferniarch Greataxe.
None of the Draining Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Vampirism.

name: Drakinata
notes:
Notes
This weapon was added with the Christmas Update 2009. The name is a word twist of a similar weapon, the Naginata.

name: Dreaded Cleaver
notes:
Notes
Was a treasured item until Winter Update 2008, when this axe was added to the loot of some Vampire Lords and Werewolves.

name: Dwarven Axe
notes:
Notes
This is the best one-handed axe weapon at level 20. Part of the Dwarven Set.
Obtainable through the Dwarf Hell Quest and Griffin Shield Quest.

name: Eldritch Greataxe
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Execowtioner Axe
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Executioner
notes:
Notes
It used to be a very rare item since it was originally only dropped by Hellgorak, however it's not as rare nowadays. The first executioner was seen on Refugia.

name: Falcon Battleaxe
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Farmer's Avenger
notes:
Notes
Use the dead body of Monstor to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
Looks the same as a Pitchfork.
There is a chance of obtaining it in the Isle of Evil Quest.

name: Fire Axe
notes:
Notes
It emits a very small amount of light (makes your screen a little bit brighter). It is enchanted with eternal fire, so it does also fire damage beside the normal damage. The Summer Update 2008 changed the attack description to: 27 physical + 11 fire.

Can be obtained through the Fire Axe Quest.

name: Gilded Eldritch Greataxe
notes:
Notes
It works just like a standard Eldritch Greataxe.

name: Glooth Axe
notes:
Notes
Breaks after 2 hits (this includes physical spells).Can be obtained by using a Glooth Bag.

name: Glorious Axe
notes:
Notes
Not used by many players as a weapon. Usually found in low prices at the market.

name: Golden Axe
notes:
Notes
Part of The Dream Courts Quest.
The weight and flavor text of this item are an allusion to an Arcade game with the same name.

name: Golden Sickle
notes:
Notes
Not very useful, mostly used as decoration item. This used to be loot from Witch a long time ago.

name: Grand Sanguine Battleaxe
notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet dropped by Bakragore when fighting him under the influence of Bakragore's Burden.

name: Grand Sanguine Hatchet
notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet dropped by Bakragore when fighting him under the influence of Bakragore's Burden.

name: Great Axe
notes:
Notes
Great Axes were the weapons of the dwarven kings. They were impossible to wield by any normal Dwarf, and it would have needed even a strength of an ox to use it. It has been said that dwarven warriors able to wield such a weapon were even able to kill Cyclopes unarmed. With this weapon they could kill a Dragon in a single blow. For a very long time this was considered the best and strongest axe in Tibia.

name: Guardian Axe
notes:
Notes
Part of the Guardian Set.
Available in reward chests after defeating Jaul, Obujos and/or Tanjis.

name: Guardian Halberd
notes:
Notes
A weaker version of the Dragon Lance.
Obtained from the Behemoth Quest.

name: Halberd
notes:
Notes
Quite good two handed weapon for medium levels. Also a good item for Lootbags.

name: Hand Axe
notes:
Notes
A useful weapon for knights to train with; it is the second weakest axe weapon.

name: Hatchet
notes:
Notes
The best axe weapon found on the island of Rookgard. Despite it being heavy, it is still a great source of money for those desperate low levels in need of cash. Hatchets can normally be found all over the ground in hunting areas, making it easy to gather them without much effort.

name: Headchopper
notes:
Notes
Reward from the Arena, Greenhorn level.

name: Heavy Trident
notes:
Notes
Item introduced in the Summer update 2011.

name: Hellforged Axe
notes:
Notes
A good weapon until you can afford a Crystalline Axe or better. Using the crystalline axe, the difference in damage is a mere +5 points because of the +1 Axe Fighting, however your spells will hit harder too. 
Obtainable in the The Inquisition Quest.

name: Heroic Axe
notes:
Notes
Reward from the Arena, Scrapper level.

name: Hive Scythe
notes:
Notes
It has one less attack point than a Royal Axe, but is a fair bit cheaper.
Can be obtained from Gooey Masses.

name: Ice Hatchet
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Impaler
notes:
Notes
First obtained in Furora.

name: Inferniarch Battleaxe
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be used in the Doomforge to be turned into either a Siphoning Inferniarch Battleaxe, Rending Inferniarch Battleaxe, or Draining Inferniarch Battleaxe.

name: Inferniarch Greataxe
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be used in the Doomforge to be turned into either a Siphoning Inferniarch Greataxe, Rending Inferniarch Greataxe, or Draining Inferniarch Greataxe.

name: Knight Axe
notes:
Notes
This is the best one-handed axe weapon at level 25.
Can be obtained through the Orc Fortress Quest and Deeper Fibula Quest.

name: Lion Axe
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Mino Lance
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Mythril Axe
notes:
Notes
The Mythril Axe on Harmonia.

name: Naga Axe
notes:
Notes
It's part of the Naga Set.

name: Naginata
notes:
Notes
A fairly rarely seen weapon, as it isn't particularly strong and the quest is too difficult for low levels to complete alone. It is slightly better than the Daramian Waraxe as the best two-handed axe weapon at level 25, as it has higher defense value.
Can be obtained through the Naginata Quest.

name: Noble Axe
notes:
Notes
A bit more expensive than a Fire Axe; after The Summer Update 2008 it became a common weapon for knights level 35+ because it shares Fire Axe's total attack points in physical damage. This makes it much more effective on dragons and other fireproof monsters.

name: Obsidian Lance
notes:
Notes
Good two-handed axe for lower levels, the best two-handed axe weapon at level 20.It looks the same as Sugatrap's Obsidian Lance.Obtainable through Griffin Shield Quest.This lance is one of the items needed to do the Obsidian Knife Quest.

name: Ogre Choppa
notes:
Notes
It can be sold to NPC Mugruu after finishing Vuzrog's questline. Can be obtained from Shaggy Ogre Bags.

name: Orcish Axe
notes:
Notes
While once a rather useless axe, it is now the best one-handed axe for characters under level 20. Axe fighting is becoming more and more popular within the last year and the Orcish Axe is in demand a lot more than the past. To a lower level this could be considered a nice loot.

name: Ornamented Axe
notes:
Notes
Wyrms dropped them for a short period of time 2 months after the summer update of 2008, then wyrms ceased dropping it.Even though this axe can be seen around on various servers nowadays it became somewhat rare because only Ferumbras and Ferumbras Mortal Shell drops it today.

name: Phantasmal Axe
notes:
Notes
This is the second best obtainable two handed fire weapon in the game. The Eldritch Warmace and Eldritch Claymore are tied for the best, but they're extremely expensive and rare. Making the Phantasmal axe the most viable option of the three.
This is a very good weapon for places where fire damage is needed, like: Talahu, Carnivora's Rocks and Underground Glooth Factory. Although one should be careful when hunting at lower levels. Could even be used in the Secret Library, in the ice section, but this of course, is a risky strategy.
In comparison to other weapon styles, it beats both the Summerblade and Cobra Club in damage output, while being cheaper than the two. However, it lacks the option to use a shield, making it a high risk, high reward weapon.

name: Plague Bite
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Ravager's Axe
notes:
Notes
One of the most rare and powerful two-handed Axe Weapons that was spotted for the first time on Berylia. As it is dropped by Morguthis, one of the stronger (and, due to Shredderthrowers, more tedious to camp) Pharaohs, it is one of the less commonly seen Pharaoh Rares. This item, or a similar item can be seen on the counter behind Ormuhn, can not be identified correctly because of a Skull above it. It has gained much in popularity after imbuement slots were implemented. Because of its three imbuement slots it is a viable option for anyone using a two-handed axe.

name: Ravenwing
notes:
Notes
A rarely seen weapon, exists on multiple Game Worlds. Most used for decorative purposes.

name: Reaper's Axe
notes:
Notes
The first one was looted on the 21st June 2008 on Celesta during the Megiddo POI quest service.

name: Rending Inferniarch Battleaxe
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained via the Doomforge by using a Inferniarch Battleaxe.
None of the Rending Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Strike.

name: Rending Inferniarch Greataxe
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained via the Doomforge by using an Inferniarch Greataxe.
None of the Rending Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Strike.

name: Rift Lance
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Ripper Lance
notes:
Notes
This is the best two-handed axe weapon without any required level.

name: Royal Axe
notes:
Notes
A decent axe weapon for level 75s. A suggested upgrade is the Deepling Axe at level 80.
Can be obtained through The Ultimate Challenges Quest, Warlord Level.

name: Ruthless Axe
notes:
Notes
Considered a quite rare weapon in the past. It has almost the same sprite as a Steel Axe, however this one has a double blade.

name: Sanguine Battleaxe
notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet, which can be looted from any boss in the 4 areas of the Rotten Blood Quest if some conditions are met. Can also be obtained through a Crimson Offering.

name: Sanguine Hatchet
notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet, which can be looted from any boss in the 4 areas of the Rotten Blood Quest if some conditions are met. Can also be obtained through a Crimson Offering.

name: Scythe of the Reaper
notes:
Notes
Use the dead body of Boogey to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
Looks similar to a Scythe, but then with a touch of death.
There is a chance of obtaining it in the Isle of Evil Quest.

name: Sickle
notes:
Notes
The weakest Axe Weapon, making it the most effective weapon for training the axe fighting skill. It can also be used to harvest sugar cane. After the summer update of 2007, the loot value increased on main due to the raised popularity of playing a knight. Since 8.71 update you can buy this weapon in mainlands. 
You can use the Squeezing Gear of Girlpower as a substitution for this tool.

name: Siphoning Inferniarch Battleaxe
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained via the Doomforge by using a Inferniarch Battleaxe.
None of the Siphoning Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Void.

name: Siphoning Inferniarch Greataxe
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained via the Doomforge by using an Inferniarch Greataxe.
None of the Siphoning Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Void.

name: Solar Axe
notes:
Notes
Can currently be seen in Pythius The Rotten's treasure room; the axe is being covered by a Red Gem.
Before Gamemasters were dismissed, CipSoft gave them a list of items to choose as a token of their appreciation and this is one of the items that were on this list.
On August 6, 2010, GM Leen Leonhart created a thread that announced she chose a Solar Axe as reward and opened an auction.
On August 4, 2010, GM Dragonas created a thread that he'd possibly be selling one which on August 6, 2010 he made official that he was auctioning one. You can view original Solar Axes auctions on these threads: Solar Axe auction! (for real) (held by GM Leen Leonhart), Solar Axe  (held by GM Exilya), Solar Axe Auction (held by GM Dragonas, the thread held by Pytru (GM Havey), who would choose a Solar Axe, a Dark Trinity Mace or The Epiphany, here, or in thread made by GM Aestyn here.
On August 11, 2021, GM Kosari announced their Solar Axe for sale on Luminera's Trade Board, where the axe was based at the time.

name: Soulbiter
notes:
Notes
Part of the Soul Set and one of the best Axe Weapons in the game.
It is a possible reward of the Soul War Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Soul Set the first time said quest is completed.
This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Desire, which can be looted from any enemy or boss in the 5 areas of the Soul War Quest if some conditions are met.

name: Souleater (Axe)
notes:
Notes
Part of the Soul Set and one of the best Axe Weapons in the game.
It is a possible reward of the Soul War Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Soul Set the first time said quest is completed.
This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Desire, which can be looted from any enemy or boss in the 5 areas of the Soul War Quest if some conditions are met.

name: Steel Axe
notes:
Notes
A player who joined in the knight vocation can choose this axe in the attached cellar of the Island of Destiny. Looks almost the same as a Ruthless Axe but with only one blade.

name: Stonecutter Axe
notes:
Notes
A very strong axe weapon, recommended for level 90-100s until Hellforged Axe or Crystalline Axe becomes available. It has a high defensive value, although defense on a one-handed weapon has no real value. Its +3 defense modifier on the other hand makes it useful for blocking.
Can only be obtained through the Annihilator Quest.

name: Throwing Axe
notes:
Notes
Part of the Jungle Set.

name: Titan Axe
notes:
Notes
This axe was considered rare at one point. However, several creatures in Tibia drop this item nowadays. Can be obtained from Shaggy Ogre Bags.

name: Twin Axe
notes:
Notes
Was first seen on Trimera and first to be dropped by Ghazbaran in Malvera. One of the Pharaoh Rares.

name: Umbral Axe
notes:
Notes
This weapon can only be imbued with Basic imbuements. Intricate and Powerful imbuements are not available for  Crude and Regular Umbral weapons.
See also Umbral Creation.

name: Umbral Chopper
notes:
Notes
This weapon can only be imbued with Basic imbuements. Intricate and Powerful imbuements are not available for  Crude and Regular Umbral weapons.
See also Umbral Creation.

name: Umbral Master Axe
notes:
Notes
Also obtainable through Umbral Creation.

name: Umbral Master Chopper
notes:
Notes
Also obtainable through Umbral Creation.

name: Vile Axe
notes:
Notes
A rare axe. Decreased in rareness after Updates/8.2 when Hellgorak was proven to drop it in large amounts, but after a patch this was reduced. Still considered rare with a high value on most servers. Mostly used as decoration. Mages of a high level, might consider using it instead of rods or wands in some cases, since it gives a +3 defense bonus, and is on most servers the cheapest item that gives the +3 defense modifier.

name: War Axe
notes:
Notes
A rare but strong Axe, and the strongest weapon that could be enchanted. It could be seen in the Morguthis Treasure Room long before it was available to players.
Due to it's similarity in appearance to an Angelic Axe it's some times used in a bait and switch scam, those trading in person are advised to be careful.

name: Warrior's Axe
notes:
Notes
Part of the Warrior's Set. A very good One-Handed axe from level 40 to 60. Also a very cheap weapon.

name: Zaoan Halberd
notes:
Notes
Part of the Zaoan Set. There is a daily respawn on the top of the Zzaion palace.
